underConstruction.title: Platform under construction
underConstruction.message: We are still assembling the OpenG7 experience. Some sections may be incomplete for now.

validation.caPhone: Enter a valid Canadian phone number

profile.title: Complete your partner profile
profile.description: Let trusted contacts know who you are. Confirm your organisation, role and preferred sectors so matches stay relevant.

feed.title: Explore your curated activity feed
feed.description: Use filters and keyboard shortcuts to scan new requests, sector briefings and alerts from your network in real time.

alerts.title: Activate proactive alerts
alerts.description: Choose the channels that work for you: email digests, browser notifications or webhook automations for your CRM.

registration.title: Register your company on OpenG7
registration.subtitle: Connect with Canadian and international partners by sharing your capabilities and target markets.

badges.timeline: Manual review in under five business days

highlight.marketDesc: Showcase your offer to public buyers, clusters and private partners.
highlight.complianceDesc: Export controls, sanctions screening and privacy aligned with GDPR/DPDPA.
highlight.speedDesc: Initial review by the OpenG7 team within five business days.

sidebar.title: Registration checklist
sidebar.description: Have these items ready to streamline the review of your application.
sidebar.point1: Legal identity, website and primary sectors.
sidebar.point2: Trade scope, provinces and countries you serve.
sidebar.point3: Contact information for a decision maker or Canadian representative.

registration.formLead: Start your application in a few minutes.
registration.formSubtitle: Our partnerships team validates every submission. We will reach out before publishing your profile.
registration.reviewTime: Every submission is handled confidentially by the OpenG7 partnerships team until it goes live.
registration.foreignBanner: Based outside Canada? Select your headquarter country and indicate the markets you cover. OpenG7 welcomes international registrations tied to trade with Canada.
registration.hqProvince: Province or territory (if based in Canada)
registration.descriptionHint: Summarise your offer and key clients (optional).
registration.capacityHint: e.g. annual capacity, ISO standards, export requirements.
registration.contactHint: This person will receive the confirmation and follow-up questions.
registration.acceptedTerms: I agree to the OpenG7 privacy and usage policies

assessment.title: 2. Compliance assessment
assessment.desc: Our analysts screen sanctions, certifications and regulatory compliance.

publication.title: 3. Launch & onboarding

validation.list: Use a comma-separated list with up to 20 short entries.

security.subtitle: Manage your account status, password and email confirmation settings.

password.title: Change password
password.error: We could not update your password. Please try again.
password.weak: Use uppercase, lowercase, a number and a symbol.
password.sameAsCurrent: Your new password must be different from the current password.

emailChange.title: Change email address
emailChange.help: Enter your current password to request an email change confirmation link.
emailChange.success: A confirmation email has been sent to your new address.
emailChange.error: We could not start the email change flow. Please try again.
emailChange.sameAsCurrent: Use an email address different from your current one.

login.title: Sign in
login.subtitle: Access your secure workspace to coordinate partnerships and exchanges.
login.subtitleLocal: Use your internal credentials to pick up where you left off with your secured exchanges.
login.subtitleHybrid: Choose how you want to sign in: internal credentials or your company provider.
login.subtitleSsoOnly: Select your company provider to continue to the OpenG7 platform.
login.securityCopy: Your credentials are encrypted and processed under GDPR. Only authorised teams can view your information.
login.ssoOnlyHelperBody: Click the button above to open your provider. Once the authentication completes, you will be redirected back here automatically.
login.activationEmailSent: If the account is eligible for activation, a confirmation email has been sent.

login.activationAlreadyConfirmed: This account is already confirmed. Contact your administrator if access is still blocked.

hero.body: Follow the secure instructions we send by email to regain access to your account.

forgotPassword.title: Forgot your password?

hero.title: Create your OpenG7 account

compliance.title: Compliance & audit trail

timeline.title: Three steps to activate your access

review.title: Confidential review
review.copy: Our team validates the information and confirms alignment with the G7 mandate.

activation.title: Activation & onboarding

form.subtitle: We vet each request individually to protect sensitive data across the ecosystem.
form.review: A trusted operations team reviews every submission. Expect a personalised acknowledgement in your inbox.
form.passwordHint: Use at least 10 characters with uppercase letters, numbers and a symbol.

support.title: Support that starts before you log in

items.onboarding: Guided onboarding journey with interactive documentation.
items.security: Continuous security controls with certified SOC oversight.
items.contact: Priority support via encrypted email and dedicated hotline.

credits.title: An ecosystem built together
credits.subtitle: OpenG7 thrives thanks to collaboration across innovators, decision-makers and community catalysts nationwide.

methodology.title: How a contribution becomes measurable impact
methodology.copy: We operate in short loops: field listening, rapid delivery, and open validation with public and private partners.

steps.title: 1. Surface a concrete need
steps.copy: Field teams report the highest-friction issues across corridors and value chains.

steps.title: 2. Co-design the response
steps.copy: Product, data and partner teams shape a testable solution within a few sprints.

steps.title: 3. Ship and measure
steps.copy: Every release is tracked with adoption, impact and qualitative feedback indicators.

contributors.title: Contributors
contributors.caption: A multidisciplinary crew spanning product, data, design and partnership enablement.
contributors.emptyDescription: Try another query or reset filters to see the full team again.

items.name: Amina Lefèvre
items.impact: Defined the visual DNA and modular grid.

community.title: Ready to build Canada’s economic future?
community.copy: Add your name to the people shaping a more agile interprovincial economy.

governance.title: Governance
governance.copy: Our commitments reinforce partner and citizen trust.

points.open: Code & data as open as possible

pillars.nationalCoordination_desc: Harmonise interprovincial flows and shared references.
pillars.digitalInnovation_desc: Interactive maps, open AI and real-time integrations.
pillars.communityPartnerships_desc: Connect SMEs, clusters and local institutions.

items.title: National coordination
items.summary: Harmonise interprovincial flows and shared references.

items.title: Digital innovation

items.summary: Connect SMEs, clusters and local institutions.

hero.title: Governance that earns trust
hero.subtitle: OpenG7 is stewarded as public digital infrastructure where transparency, accountability and shared leadership guide every release.

commitments.title: Public mandate
commitments.copy: Guided by an intergovernmental charter that centres public interest above commercial objectives.

commitments.title: Multi-partner leadership
commitments.copy: Federal, provincial, territorial and civic partners co-design priorities and evaluate outcomes together.

commitments.title: Evidence-first decisions
commitments.copy: Policies, budgets and releases are supported by open metrics and impact stories reviewed each quarter.

commitments.title: Indigenous inclusion
commitments.copy: Indigenous economic leaders hold a permanent seat to embed reconciliation and data sovereignty.

board.title: Stewardship board
board.subtitle: Representatives from federal innovation, provincial economic development, Indigenous leadership and civic tech maintain our mandate.

members.name: Élise Martel
members.role: Chair — Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada
members.background: Bridges policy, procurement and agile delivery for national digital services.
members.focus: Keeps cohesion between federal investments and regional adoption.

members.name: Noah Desrosiers
members.background: Leads the provincial cluster strategy and interprovincial trade facilitation.
members.focus: Ensures SMEs benefit equitably from marketplace visibility.

members.name: Dr. Aanya Greyeyes
members.background: Advocates for Indigenous data sovereignty and community-led prosperity.
members.focus: Secures consent-driven data practices and co-governed opportunities.

members.name: Sanjay Patel
members.background: Founder of the Open Exchange Observatory monitoring interoperability.
members.focus: Champions reusable APIs, open source and accessibility standards.

mandate: Guard the public-interest charter and principles of openness.
Approve release trains, funding envelopes and risk mitigations.
Ensure equity across provinces, territories and Indigenous partners.
cadence: Quarterly open sessions with published minutes and recordings.
Biannual audit of privacy, security and accessibility baselines.
Annual renewal of priorities following partner consultations.

advisory.title: Advisory circles
advisory.description: Specialist circles create the connective tissue between communities, sectors and the platform roadmap.

groups.name: Data & AI ethics council
groups.focus: Reviews algorithmic recommendations, bias mitigation and consent flows before deployment.

groups.name: Supply chain resilience forum
groups.focus: Surfaces signals from manufacturing, agri-food and energy ecosystems to shape features.

groups.name: Civic adoption guild
groups.focus: Connects municipalities, chambers of commerce and incubators to support onboarding.

advisory.inviteTitle: Bring your voice to the table
advisory.inviteCopy: We welcome contributors from coast to coast to strengthen inclusive governance.

process.title: Decisions in the open
process.subtitle: Every governance decision follows a transparent pipeline with documented evidence.

steps.title: Frame
steps.description: Partners submit a concise issue brief outlining needs, constraints and potential impact.
deliverables: Brief published to the community hub

steps.title: Co-design
steps.description: Mixed working groups iterate scenarios, privacy guardrails and funding needs.

steps.title: Decide
steps.description: The stewardship board votes in public session with rationale recorded and streamed.

steps.title: Review
steps.description: Results are measured against agreed indicators and lessons learned feed back into planning.

transparency.title: Transparency measures
transparency.subtitle: Accountability is actionable with artefacts you can review at any time.
items: Public registry of votes, declarations of interest and meeting attendance.
Financial dashboard tracking programme budgets, grants and in-kind contributions.
Privacy, security and accessibility compliance reports available every semester.
Issue tracker exposing backlog status, owners and delivery progress.

milestones.title: Launch participatory budgeting pilot for regional enhancements

privacy.title: Privacy policy
privacy.intro: We describe how we handle personal and organisational data collected through OpenG7.

hero.supporting: We follow federal privacy guidance to keep your marketplace data safe and purposeful.
hero.ctaDescription: Dedicated specialists will reply within two business days.

highlights.title: Purpose-built collection
highlights.description: We only request details needed to match partners and deliver mandated services.

highlights.title: Security by design
highlights.description: Encryption, segmentation, and audits reduce risk throughout the platform lifecycle.

highlights.title: Clear accountability
highlights.description: Named roles govern access and every request is logged for traceability.

quickNav.title: Navigate this page
quickNav.description: Skip directly to the topic you are looking for.

summaryCard.title: Privacy at a glance
summaryCard.description: Key commitments we uphold for every user and organisation.

items.label: Data minimisation
items.description: We collect the minimum personal data required to operate OpenG7 services.

items.label: Shared responsibility
items.description: Partners accessing data sign agreements that mirror these standards.

items.label: Responsive support
items.description: Privacy inquiries are tracked and answered within regulatory timelines.

contactCard.title: Need more details?
contactCard.description: Reach the privacy team for tailored guidance or to exercise your rights.

collection.title: 1. Data we collect
paragraphs: We collect account details, activity logs, and data you publish to the marketplace.
We may ingest public datasets and partner-provided information to enrich profiles.
bullets: Identification data such as name, email, and organisation.
Usage metrics like session timestamps and feature adoption.
Content metadata including uploaded documents and structured forms.

usage.title: 2. How we use the data
paragraphs: Data enables matchmaking, analytics, and service improvements.
Aggregated insights are produced to help policy and economic development teams.
bullets: Provide and secure user accounts.
Recommend relevant partners or opportunities.
Assess adoption and plan roadmap priorities.

sharing.title: 3. Sharing & disclosure
paragraphs: We share data only with authorised partners involved in delivering the service or when required by law.
Access is restricted to roles with a legitimate need and governed by agreements.

security.title: 4. Security & retention
paragraphs: We apply encryption, network segmentation, and routine audits to protect records.
Data is retained for the duration of service delivery and archived according to federal guidelines.

rights.title: 5. Your rights
paragraphs: You may request access, correction, or deletion of your personal data subject to legal obligations.
Contact us to exercise these rights and we will respond within regulatory timelines.

contact.title: 6. Contact
paragraphs: Reach the OpenG7 privacy team at privacy@openg7.org or via the administrative console.

hero.title: Choose the right OpenG7 plan for your team
hero.subtitle: Scale collaboration and analytics with plans designed for public-sector partnerships and resilient supply chains.

highlights.market: Verified suppliers across the entire G7 network
highlights.security: Enterprise-grade security with Canadian data residency

planCards.heading: Flexible plans for every stage of your export journey
planCards.subheading: All plans include secure marketplace access, bilingual support, and compliance-ready documentation.

explorer.title: Explorer
explorer.description: Ideal for organisations beginning to map partnerships and visibility.
explorer.highlight: Get started in minutes with three seats included.

features.directory: Discover verified suppliers across the G7
features.collaboration: Collaborate with up to three seats per organisation

explorer.footnote: Switch plans or cancel at any time.

analyst.title: Analyst
analyst.description: Unlock premium analytics, curated matches, and expanded team management.
analyst.highlight: Best for trade commissioners, procurement teams, and regional clusters.

features.analytics: Advanced trade analytics and export dashboards

analyst.savings: Two months free when billed annually.
analyst.footnote: Pricing shown in CAD and excludes applicable taxes.

enterprise.title: Enterprise
enterprise.description: Tailored deployments with deeper integrations, governance controls, and SLAs.

features.workshops: Strategic onboarding workshops and change management
features.integrations: Custom data integrations and private catalogues

testimonials.heading: What government and industry leaders say
testimonials.description: Provinces and regional clusters use OpenG7 to accelerate procurement and collaboration.

quebec.quote: The Analyst plan gave us a unified view of suppliers across ministries in record time.
quebec.author: Mélanie Beaulieu

saskatchewan.quote: We can prioritise introductions that align with provincial goals and measure outcomes weekly.
saskatchewan.author: Aaron Little

bc.quote: The enterprise rollout anchored our partnership program with reliable data and governance.
bc.author: Priya Narang

faq.heading: Answers for procurement teams
faq.description: Everything you need to bring OpenG7 through security, privacy, and purchasing reviews.

security.question: Where is data stored and processed?
security.answer: All customer data is hosted in Canada with redundancy across Toronto and Montréal regions. Backups are encrypted using AES-256 and stored in-region.

procurement.question: Can we issue a purchase order instead of using a credit card?
procurement.answer: Yes. Analyst annual and Enterprise plans support invoicing with purchase orders. We provide vendor forms, W9 equivalents, and security assessments on request.

billing.question: Do you offer discounts for multi-year commitments?
billing.answer: Enterprise agreements can include multi-year pricing with predictable uplifts. Analyst plans receive a 10% discount for two-year terms.

rollout.question: How long does onboarding take?
rollout.answer: Explorer accounts activate instantly. Analyst plans typically launch within two weeks, while Enterprise rollouts include a 6-week guided deployment.

soc2.label: SOC 2 Type II assessment in flight
soc2.description: Audit underway with quarterly penetration testing and continuous monitoring.

iso.label: ISO 27001-aligned controls
iso.description: Policies mapped to ISO controls with evidence packages available for review.

pipeda.label: PIPEDA & provincial privacy alignment
pipeda.description: We meet federal and provincial privacy obligations, including Québec Law 25.

support.heading: Need guidance choosing a plan?
support.description: Our team can walk you through use cases, security documentation, and rollout planning.

customerPortal.heading: Already a customer?
customerPortal.description: Sign in to manage billing, download invoices, or adjust seats in the subscription portal.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.intro: These terms govern your use of the OpenG7 platform and outline the responsibilities shared between partners.

highlights.title: Who should read this
highlights.description: Platform administrators, legal teams and procurement leads working with OpenG7.

highlights.title: Why it matters
highlights.description: Defines the trust, data sharing and accountability practices every participant signs onto.

highlights.title: Review cadence
highlights.description: Reviewed twice per year with provincial, territorial and federal governance partners.

summary.title: Operate with shared care
summary.description: Treat OpenG7 as mission-critical infrastructure for your organisation and its partners.
points: Administrators steward accounts and escalate incidents promptly.
Data sharing respects confidentiality, licences and partner expectations.
Policy updates ship with transparent timelines and archived versions.

items.title: Share accurate information
items.description: Keep organisation profiles, opportunities and datasets truthful and current so partners can rely on them.

items.title: Protect community data
items.description: Apply your internal safeguards to OpenG7 just as you would to other trusted collaboration environments.

items.title: Engage with integrity
items.description: Use the platform to build fair, lawful collaborations that respect every participant’s mandate.

timeline.title: Revision timeline
timeline.description: Key updates to the Terms of Service.

items.label: Operational launch
items.description: Established the baseline terms covering beta-to-live transition and availability commitments.

items.label: Security uplift
items.description: Added joint incident management duties and clarified credential rotation expectations.

items.label: Procurement alignment
items.description: Aligned terminology with federal and provincial procurement frameworks for easier adoption.

support.title: Need bespoke agreements?
support.description: The OpenG7 governance office can adapt clauses for sectoral programmes and pilot projects.
details: Available on business days from 9:00 to 18:00 ET.
Typical response time is two business days with clear next steps.

service.title: 1. Service scope & availability
service.lede: Understand what the OpenG7 platform delivers today and how we keep it reliable.
paragraphs: OpenG7 connects Canadian organisations with partners across the G7 supply chain and powers shared intelligence for industrial collaboration.
Core marketplace features are available 24/7 with planned maintenance windows announced in advance.
checklist: Delivering a minimum 99.5% monthly uptime target for core marketplace capabilities.
Publishing maintenance and release windows at least five business days in advance.
Notifying partners whenever we introduce new data processing locations or sub-processors.

callout.title: Need the printable version?
body: A PDF copy lives in the governance workspace for procurement and audit records.

access.title: 2. Account stewardship
access.lede: Delegate the right access for your organisation and keep it current.
paragraphs: Each organisation designates at least two administrators who manage seats, roles and approvals for their teams.
Administrators ensure user profiles reflect current employment status and revoke accounts when people depart.
checklist: Review user rosters quarterly and confirm least-privilege access levels.
Enable multi-factor authentication on all administrator accounts.
Report compromised credentials to OpenG7 within 24 hours.

data.title: 3. Data handling & confidentiality
data.lede: Share datasets confidently while respecting confidentiality and licences.
paragraphs: Participants retain ownership of the datasets and content they contribute while granting OpenG7 a licence to host, transform and display it to authorised users.
We aggregate metrics to inform national insights without exposing identifiable confidential information.
checklist: Classify uploads according to your internal governance standards.
Avoid including personal information unless a separate agreement explicitly allows it.
Respect embargoes or licences that apply to partner datasets.

callout.title: Sensitive exports
body: Exports of restricted datasets require a written release or scoped API token issued by OpenG7.

conduct.title: 4. Responsible conduct
conduct.lede: Keep collaboration constructive, inclusive and lawful.
paragraphs: Interactions on OpenG7 must support lawful economic collaboration and procurement between participants.
You may not use the service to mislead partners, disrupt operations or abuse communication channels.
checklist: Posting fraudulent opportunities or misrepresenting credentials.
Attempting to probe, disable or bypass security controls.
Using platform directories for unsolicited marketing outside approved programmes.

security.title: 5. Security & incident response
security.lede: Coordinate with us to keep the ecosystem resilient.
paragraphs: OpenG7 monitors platform health and security anomalies to safeguard all participants.
We coordinate incident handling with designated security contacts from each organisation.
checklist: Notify OpenG7 within 24 hours of discovering suspected misuse or breach.
Preserve relevant system logs for at least 90 days to support investigations.
Collaborate on remediation steps and joint communications.

callout.title: Security contact list
body: Keep your security distribution list up to date so we can reach you during coordinated responses.

continuity.title: 6. Updates & change history
continuity.lede: We evolve these terms transparently with our partners.
paragraphs: We update these terms when policies, product capabilities or regulatory requirements change.
Material revisions are previewed with governance partners before they take effect.
checklist: Publish redlines and effective dates in the governance workspace.
Keep prior versions accessible for auditing and procurement records.
Provide at least 30 days’ notice for changes that materially affect data usage.

callout.title: Questions about a change?
body: Join the monthly governance clinic or email us for a walkthrough of the upcoming updates.

legal.title: Legal notice
legal.intro: Official information about the organisation operating OpenG7.

meta.title: Quick reference
meta.downloadHint: Reference document for audits and internal validation workflows.

jurisdiction.label: Jurisdiction
jurisdiction.description: All proceedings are subject to Ontario and federal legislation.

operator.title: Operator
paragraphs: OpenG7 is operated by the OpenG7 Coalition, a non-profit initiative supporting Canadian supply chain partnerships.
Registered office: 155 Laurier Ave W, Ottawa, ON, Canada.

hosting.title: Hosting & infrastructure
paragraphs: The platform is hosted in Canadian regions on accredited cloud providers meeting federal security requirements.
Disaster recovery sites are maintained in compliance with Treasury Board directives.

compliance.title: Compliance & contact
paragraphs: We comply with the Privacy Act, PIPEDA, and applicable provincial regulations.
For any legal notice, contact legal@openg7.org.

credits.title: Credits & partners
paragraphs: OpenG7 acknowledges the contributions of the following partners:
bullets: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada for strategic guidance.
Global Affairs Canada for international market intelligence.
Provincial economic development agencies for regional data pipelines.
Industry associations and cooperatives for domain expertise.

topQuestions.title: Top 5 questions

cta.title: Need a quick answer?
cta.description: Our concierge team can help you scope integrations, onboarding, or partnership questions.
cta.responseTime: We reply within one business day.

contact.sla: First response within one business day

thanks.no: Thanks, we will improve this answer.

platform.question: What is OpenG7?
answers: OpenG7 is the collaborative infrastructure connecting Canadian innovators with G7 buyers, investors, and policy partners.
The platform brings together verified company profiles, procurement briefs, and matchmaking workflows inside a secure workspace.
Each feature is co-designed with public servants and industry catalysts to ensure measurable impact and transparency.
bullets: Unified directory of vetted suppliers and opportunities.
Shared collaboration spaces for bilateral and multilateral projects.
Analytics exposing interprovincial trade flows and emerging skills.

data.question: How do you keep data accurate?
answers: We combine official registries, partner submissions, and proactive outreach to keep every profile in sync.
Automated monitors flag anomalies, while human reviewers focus on strategic sectors and high-value opportunities.
bullets: Continuous reconciliation with federal and provincial open data feeds.
Traceable version history for every change approved by administrators.
Feedback widgets so organisations can suggest corrections in context.

pricing.question: Is there a cost to join?
answers: The discovery tier is free and unlocks the national directory, saved searches, and public insight briefs.
Premium plans add integration APIs, portfolio analytics, and dedicated visibility campaigns tailored to your objectives.
bullets: Discovery: free, unlimited seats, national directory access.
Growth: monthly subscription with trade flow analytics and concierge support.
Alliance: bespoke partnerships for clusters and government programmes.

support.question: How do I request support?
answers: You can open a ticket from any page via the help launcher or email support@openg7.org.
Premium subscribers get a concierge channel with shared dashboards and milestone reviews.
bullets: Contextual playbooks and tips embedded in every workflow.
Live onboarding clinics twice a month.
Integration office hours for technical teams.

partners.question: Who are the programme partners?
answers: OpenG7 is stewarded with federal, provincial, and industry partners committed to sustainable and inclusive trade.
Partnerships are renewed annually with shared impact metrics that are published in our transparency report.
bullets: Innovation, trade, and procurement departments across the G7.
Provincial economic development agencies and export councils.
Industry alliances representing clean tech, agri-food, digital, and advanced manufacturing.

incotermsDesc.FCA: Goods handed to the carrier appointed by the buyer.
incotermsDesc.FOB: Loaded on board, risk transfers at the port of shipment.
incotermsDesc.DDP: Supplier covers duties and final delivery.
incotermsDesc.CPT: Freight paid to the agreed place, risk transfers to the buyer.
incotermsDesc.DAP: Delivered to the agreed site, import duties on the buyer side.
